alert.note: Alert for Sumter (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 16 at 6:42PM CDT until June 16 at 7:45PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: The National Weather Service in Birmingham has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southern Sumter County in west central Alabama... * Until 745 PM CDT. * At 642 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Boyd, or near York, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Livingston, York, Cuba, Boyd, The University Of West Alabama, Bluffport, Coatopa, Dug Hill, Kinterbish, Old Mallard Airport, Demopolis Lock And Dam, Lilita, McDowell, Bellamy, I 20 Welcome Center At Cuba, Whitfield, Ward and Payneville. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
